intro: Catabrosa nutans, commonly known as the drooping catabrosa, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its pendulous, showy flowers that bloom in shades of red, pink, and white. Its leaves are ovate and covered in soft, fuzzy hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Catabrosa nutans thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
